docs.snippet: Sharply increased agricultural ports coincident with a radical ?? traction in this country's imports so far this year are building up a multiplicity of exchange and trade restrictions which will harase American shippers through the coming Fall and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sharply increased agricultural ports coincident with a radical ?? traction in this country's imports so far this year are building up a multiplicity of exchange and trade restrictions which will harase American shippers through the coming Fall and Winter, exporters predicted here last week.
docs.abstract: Foreign countries shift from indus to agr imports

headline.main: FARM EXPORT RISE SNARLS EXCHANGE; With Import Volume Declining Exporters Face a Tangle of Trade Restrictions FINISHED GOODS SUPPER Crop Failures Abroad Cause Foreign Nations to Shift Their Purchases Here

docs.snippet: The Chaco peace conference, after three years of arduous and unsuccessful efforts to settle the territorial dispute between Bolivia and Paraguay, ran into a new impasse this week which threatens a definite breakdown of the negotiations.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Chaco peace conference, after three years of arduous and unsuccessful efforts to settle the territorial dispute between Bolivia and Paraguay, ran into a new impasse this week which threatens a definite breakdown of the negotiations.

headline.main: TWO ARMIES BLOCK CHACO PEACE PACT; Three Years' Effort to Bring Bolivia and Paraguay to Terms Faces Failure ARBITRATION IS IN DOUBT Reason for Failure A Pan-American Effort Arrangement Rejected PREMIER AT BELFAST SEEKING CHACO PEACE

docs.snippet: The United States, re-established as the world's largest producer and consumer of beer following relegalization in 1933, produced 58,748,087 barrels, or 68,932,000 hectolitres, in 1937, according to a report made public yesterday by the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States, re-established as the world's largest producer and consumer of beer following relegalization in 1933, produced 58,748,087 barrels, or 68,932,000 hectolitres, in 1937, according to a report made public yesterday by the United Brewers Industrial Foundation.
docs.abstract: Rept on U S beer output, 1937

headline.main: UNITED STATES LEADS IN BEER PRODUCTION; Manufacture Here in 1937 Rose to 58,748,087 Barrels
